description: Use the object literal notation to create and initialize objects.
title: The Object Literal

lessons.title: Objects
lessons.description: Learn about objects and how to create and initialize them in JavaScript.

lessons.title: The Object Literal
lessons.description: Use the object literal notation to create and initialize objects.

lessons.title: Object Characteristics Summary
lessons.description: Let's summarize what we've learnt about objects and their characteristics.

lessons.title: The dot and bracket notations
lessons.description: Learn about the square bracket notation, another way of accessing object properties.

lessons.title: Difference between dot and bracket notations
lessons.description: Learn about the differences between the dot notation and the bracket notation to access object properties. And when to use what?

lessons.title: Nested Objects
lessons.description: Objects can be nested within other objects. Here's how.

lessons.title: Revisiting === for objects
lessons.description: We'll now revisit the === equality operator and see how it works with objects and object equality.

lessons.title: Revisiting undefined vs null for objects
lessons.description: We'll now revisit the distinction between undefined and null types in the context of object properties.

lessons.title: Deleting attributes with the delete operator
lessons.description: Learn how to delete properties from an object.

lessons.title: Introducing Arrays
lessons.description: Learn about arrays in JavaScript and how you can create and access array elements.

lessons.title: The Secret behind JavaScript Arrays
lessons.description: In this video, you'll learn about the secret behind JavaScript arrays. And what you learn may surprise you. Just don't tell anyone!

lessons.title: Wrapper Objects
lessons.description: JavaScript creates wrapper objects for some simple primitive types. In this video, you'll learn how that works.
